title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement paul.johnson50@nhs.net. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Making ggplot graphics using an SCW style
title: Making ggplot graphics using an SCW style
text: {scwplot} package provides functions applying consistent SCW-branded aesthetics ggplot visualisations R, well additional functionality produces clean plots makes plotting R easier.

title: Making ggplot graphics using an SCW style
text: {scwplot} available CRAN. order install package, must directly GitHub repository {devtools}, using code : haven’t already installed {devtools}, also run first line code code chunk.
code: # install.packages('devtools')  devtools::install_github("NHS-South-Central-and-West/scwplot")

title: Making ggplot graphics using an SCW style
text: six primary functions {scwplot} package. functions can subdivided SCW theme functions additional utility functions. SCW theme functions follows: scw_theme() scale_fill_scw() scale_colour_scw() following functions add additional utility package: add_commas() finalise_plot()

title: Making ggplot graphics using an SCW style
text: package takes lot inspiration NHS-R community’s {NHSRtheme} package BBC’s {bbplot} package.

what: Arrange alignment and save SCW ggplot chart — finalise_plot
title: Arrange alignment and save SCW ggplot chart — finalise_plot
text: Running function save plot correct guidelines publication SCW graphic. left align title, subtitle source, add NHS logo bottom right save specified location.

title: Arrange alignment and save SCW ggplot chart — finalise_plot
code: finalise_plot(   plot_name,   source_name,   save_filepath = file.path(Sys.getenv("TMPDIR"), "tmp-nc.png"),   width_pixels = 640,   height_pixels = 450 )

title: Arrange alignment and save SCW ggplot chart — finalise_plot
text: plot_name variable name plot created want format save source_name text want come text 'Source:' bottom left hand side side save_filepath Exact filepath want plot saved width_pixels Width pixels want save chart - defaults 640 height_pixels Height pixels want save chart - defaults 450

title: Arrange alignment and save SCW ggplot chart — finalise_plot
text: (Invisibly) updated ggplot object.

title: Arrange alignment and save SCW ggplot chart — finalise_plot
code: if (FALSE) { finalise_plot(   plot_name = myplot,   source = "The source for my data",   save_filepath = "filename_that_my_plot_should_be_saved_to-nc.png",   width_pixels = 640,   height_pixels = 450 ) }

title: get_images — get_images
text: View images icons saved within package relevant file paths utilise .

title: get_images — get_images
code: get_images()

title: Diverging Colour Palettes — pal_diverging
text: Diverging colour palettes used encode numerical information ordered meaningful midpoint meaningful extreme values. example, five-point scale used measure attitudes survey, Strongly Agree Strongly Disagree, Neither Agree Disagree, require diverging colour palette. Diverging palettes combine two different hues, highest chroma (intensity colour) representing extreme values, neutral midpoint value intersection two hues.

title: Diverging Colour Palettes — pal_diverging
code: pal_diverging(   palette = c("blue_green", "blue_yellow", "blue_red"),   alpha = 1,   reverse = FALSE )

title: Diverging Colour Palettes — pal_diverging
text: palette Currently two diverging colour palettes available: "blue_green" (9-colour blue-grey-green palette using NHS Blue, NHS Pale Grey, NHS Aqua Green), blue_yellow_red (9-colour blue-yellow-red palette using NHS Blue NHS Pale Grey), blue_red (9-colour blue--red palette uses NHS Blue NHS Pale Grey). alpha Transparency level, real number (0, 1]. See alpha rgb details. reverse default, FALSE, generates colour palette defined, TRUE generates colour palette reverse order.

title: Diverging Colour Palettes — pal_diverging
code: scales::show_col(pal_diverging(palette = "blue_green")(9))  scales::show_col(pal_diverging(palette = "blue_yellow")(9))  scales::show_col(pal_diverging(palette = "blue_red")(9))  scales::show_col(pal_diverging(palette = "blue_yellow", alpha = 0.7)(9))  scales::show_col(pal_diverging(palette = "blue_red", reverse = TRUE)(9))

title: Qualitative Colour Palettes — pal_qualitative
text: Qualitative (sometimes called categorical) colour palettes used encode categorical information meaningful order. example, car manufacturers sports teams, without context specifically indicates natural order, unordered categories. Qualitative colour palettes include colours similar "perceptual weights", meaning colour clearly distinguishable , colour significantly distinct rest palette.

title: Qualitative Colour Palettes — pal_qualitative
code: pal_qualitative(palette = c("nhs", "scw", "warm"), alpha = 1)

title: Qualitative Colour Palettes — pal_qualitative
text: palette Currently three qualitative colour palettes available: "scw" (5-colour palette includes NHS Blue, NHS Light Blue, SCW Dark Blue), "nhs" (5-colour palette includes NHS Dark Blue, NHS Blue, NHS Light Blue, NHS Mid Grey), warm (6-colour palette includes NHS Blue, NHS Warm Yellow, NHS Mid Grey, SCW Dark Blue). alpha Transparency level, real number (0, 1]. See alpha rgb details.

title: Qualitative Colour Palettes — pal_qualitative
code: scales::show_col(pal_qualitative(palette = "nhs")(5))  scales::show_col(pal_qualitative(palette = "scw")(5))  scales::show_col(pal_qualitative(palette = "warm")(5))

title: Generate Colour Palette — pal_ramp
text: Create palette, supplied colour values, either selecting n evenly spaced colours colour values, discrete = TRUE, interpolated palette full length colour values.

title: Generate Colour Palette — pal_ramp
code: pal_ramp(values, discrete = FALSE)

title: Generate Colour Palette — pal_ramp
text: values Colour values discrete palette fitted discrete continuous data? default, FALSE, interpolates continuous colour palette supplied colour values, TRUE selects n evenly spaced colours supplied colour values.

title: Sequential Colour Palettes — pal_sequential
text: Sequential colour palettes used encode numerical information natural order (data can ordered high low, vice versa). use sequential palette typically indicates importance significance values varies line natural order data. Values higher luminance (lighter colours) generally less important, values lower luminance (darker colours) indicates greater importance.

title: Sequential Colour Palettes — pal_sequential
code: pal_sequential(   palette = c("blues", "dark_blues", "blue_grey", "blue_green_yellow"),   alpha = 1,   reverse = FALSE )

title: Sequential Colour Palettes — pal_sequential
text: palette Currently four sequential colour palettes available: "blues" (9-colour single-hue NHS Blue palette), "dark_blues" (9-colour single-hue SCW Dark Blue palette), "blue_grey" (9-colour multi-hue palette uses SCW Dark Blue NHS Pale Grey), "blue_green_yellow" (9-colour multi-hue palette generated using NHS Blue, NHS Aqua Green, NHS Warm Yellow). alpha Transparency level, real number (0, 1]. See alpha rgb details. reverse default, FALSE, generates colour palette defined, TRUE generates colour palette reverse order.

title: Sequential Colour Palettes — pal_sequential
code: scales::show_col(pal_sequential(palette = "blues")(9))  scales::show_col(pal_sequential(palette = "dark_blues")(9))  scales::show_col(pal_sequential(palette = "blue_grey")(9))  scales::show_col(pal_sequential(palette = "blue_green_yellow")(9))  scales::show_col(pal_sequential(palette = "blue_green", alpha = 0.7)(9))  scales::show_col(pal_sequential(palette = "blue_green", reverse = TRUE)(9))

text: list SCW colour palettes. Structured list lists first level palette type (NHS, SCW, Sequential, Diverging, Qualitative) second level palettes available palette type.

code: palettes

title: Complete list of all SCW colour palettes — palettes
text: list 5 lists.

title: SCW Diverging Colour Palettes — scale_colour_diverging
text: See pal_diverging details.

title: SCW Diverging Colour Palettes — scale_colour_diverging
code: scale_colour_diverging(   ...,   alpha = 1,   reverse = TRUE,   discrete = FALSE,   palette = c("blue_green", "blue_yellow", "blue_red") )  scale_fill_diverging(   ...,   alpha = 1,   reverse = TRUE,   discrete = FALSE,   palette = c("blue_green", "blue_yellow", "blue_red") )  scale_color_diverging(   ...,   alpha = 1,   reverse = TRUE,   discrete = FALSE,   palette = c("blue_green", "blue_yellow", "blue_red") )

title: SCW Diverging Colour Palettes — scale_colour_diverging
text: ... additional parameters discrete_scale alpha Transparency level, real number (0, 1]. See alpha rgb details. reverse default, FALSE, generates colour palette defined, TRUE generates colour palette reverse order. discrete data Whether data palette applied discrete continuous. palette Currently two diverging colour palettes available: "blue_green" (9-colour blue-grey-green palette using NHS Blue, NHS Pale Grey, NHS Aqua Green), blue_yellow_red (9-colour blue-yellow-red palette using NHS Blue NHS Pale Grey), blue_red (9-colour blue--red palette uses NHS Blue NHS Pale Grey).

title: SCW Qualitative Colour Palettes — scale_colour_qualitative
text: See pal_qualitative details.

title: SCW Qualitative Colour Palettes — scale_colour_qualitative
code: scale_colour_qualitative(palette = c("nhs", "scw", "warm"), alpha = 1, ...)  scale_fill_qualitative(palette = c("nhs", "scw", "warm"), alpha = 1, ...)

title: SCW Qualitative Colour Palettes — scale_colour_qualitative
text: palette Currently three qualitative colour palettes available: "scw" (5-colour palette includes NHS Blue, NHS Light Blue, SCW Dark Blue), "nhs" (5-colour palette includes NHS Dark Blue, NHS Blue, NHS Light Blue, NHS Mid Grey), warm (6-colour palette includes NHS Blue, NHS Warm Yellow, NHS Mid Grey, SCW Dark Blue). alpha Transparency level, real number (0, 1]. See alpha rgb details. ... additional parameters discrete_scale

title: SCW Sequential Colour Palettes — scale_colour_sequential
text: See pal_sequential details.

title: SCW Sequential Colour Palettes — scale_colour_sequential
code: scale_colour_sequential(   ...,   alpha = 1,   reverse = TRUE,   discrete = FALSE,   palette = c("blues", "dark_blues", "blue_grey", "blue_green_yellow") )  scale_fill_sequential(   ...,   alpha = 1,   reverse = TRUE,   discrete = FALSE,   palette = c("blues", "dark_blues", "blue_grey", "blue_green_yellow") )  scale_color_sequential(   ...,   alpha = 1,   reverse = TRUE,   discrete = FALSE,   palette = c("blues", "dark_blues", "blue_grey", "blue_green_yellow") )

title: SCW Sequential Colour Palettes — scale_colour_sequential
text: ... additional parameters discrete_scale alpha Transparency level, real number (0, 1]. See alpha rgb details. reverse default, FALSE, generates colour palette defined, TRUE generates colour palette reverse order. discrete data Whether data palette applied discrete continuous. palette Currently four sequential colour palettes available: "blues" (9-colour single-hue NHS Blue palette), "dark_blues" (9-colour single-hue SCW Dark Blue palette), "blue_grey" (9-colour multi-hue palette uses SCW Dark Blue NHS Pale Grey), "blue_green_yellow" (9-colour multi-hue palette generated using NHS Blue, NHS Aqua Green, NHS Warm Yellow).

what: Add SCW theme to ggplot figures — theme_scw
title: Add SCW theme to ggplot figures — theme_scw
text: function allows add SCW theme ggplot graphics.

title: Add SCW theme to ggplot figures — theme_scw
code: theme_scw(base_size = 15, base_family = "sans", grid_y = TRUE, grid_x = FALSE)

title: Add SCW theme to ggplot figures — theme_scw
text: base_size base font size, given pts (default = 15) base_family base font family (default = "sans") grid_y show major panel grid lines y-axis (default = TRUE) grid_x show major panel grid lines x-axis (default = FALSE)

title: Add SCW theme to ggplot figures — theme_scw
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, cty)) +   geom_point() +   theme_scw()
